   1301.02  APPLICATION FOR PERMIT.
   The application for a  permit shall be in writing, and shall contain
duplicate copies of all necessary site plans and specifications, the amount of
material to be used and the estimated value of the building or addition upon
completion.  Such application shall be upon blanks or forms to be secured at
the office of the Building and Zoning Inspector.
(Ord. 97-84.  Passed 6-17-97.)
 
   1301.03  PERMISSION TO USE PART OF STREET.
   (a)   Mayor May Grant Use of Street.  Upon an application being made to the
Mayor, he may grant any person engaged in the construction, repair or
improvement of any building or structure permission to use fractional parts of
the street, lanes, alleys or other public places, not inconsistent with the
rights of the public, provided such use is necessary for the purpose of such
construction or repair.
(1961 Code Sec. 473)
 
   (b)   Time and Space Limitation.  The permission granted shall be limited to
a reasonable time and shall specify the space permitted to be used or occupied,
which space shall in no case exceed more than one-half of such street, lane,
alley or other public space.
(1961 Code Sec. 474)
 
   (c)   Space To Be Guarded.  The person to whom such permission is granted
shall use diligence in the occupancy of such space by necessary guards and
barriers and by placing lights or other proper danger signals in the night
season, so as to prevent damage or injury to the person or property of another.
(1961 Code Sec. 475)
 
   1301.04  PERMIT FOR SANDBLASTING AND TUCK POINTING; FEE.
   No building shall hereafter be sandblasted or tuck pointed in any manner or
with any materials until plans of such sandblasting and tuck pointing have been
submitted to and approved by the Board of Control, and until a permit has been
issued therefor by the Board of Control.  A fee of five dollars ($5.00) for
such permit shall be paid to the Mayor.
(1961 Code Sec. 477)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 1303
Satellite Dish Antennas
 
1303.01   Definitions.
1303.02   Permit required.
1303.03   Application for permit.
1303.04   Location of the earth station.
1303.05   Appeals.
1303.99   Penalty.
 
   1303.01  DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   "Dish-type Satellite Signal Receiving Antennas", also referred to as
"earth stations" or "ground stations" means one, or a combination of two or
more of the following:
      (1)   A signal-receiving device (dish antenna, or dish-type antenna), the
purpose of which is to receive communication or other signals from satellites
in earth orbit and other extraterrestrial sources.
      (2)   A low noise amplifier (LNA) which is situated at the focal point of
the receiving component and the purpose of which is to magnify, store, transfer
and/or transmit electronic or light signals.
      (3)   A coaxial cable the purpose of which is to carry or transfer the
signals to a receiver.
 
   (b)   "Receiver" means a television set or radio receiver.
 
   (c)   "Dish" means that part of a satellite signal receiving antenna
characteristically shaped like a saucer or dish.
 
   (d)   "Grounding Rod" means a metal pole permanently positioned in the earth
to serve as an electrical conductor through which electrical current may safely
pass and dissipate.
(Ord. 85-24.  Passed 5-7-85.)
 
   1303.02  PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person, firm, partnership, corporation, trust or other legal entity shall
construct an earth station without a permit, nor shall construction commence
before a permit is issued in accordance with Section
1303.03.
(Ord. 85-24.  Passed 5-7-85.)
 
   1303.03  APPLICATION FOR PERMIT.
   (a)   The owner, or occupant with written permission from the owner of any
lot, premises or parcel of land within the City, who desires to construct an
earth station on such lot, premises or land parcel, must first obtain a permit
to do so from the Building and Zoning Inspector.
 
   (b)   The Building and Zoning Inspector shall issue a permit, provided the
applicant submits a written application showing the location and dimensions of
the proposed earth station; a description of the kind of earth station
proposed; and the location and dimensions of all buildings and structures on
the property.  Each application shall state the name and address of the
applicant; the property owner; and the person who is installating the earth
station.
 
   (c)   The applicant shall submit with each application the sum of ten
dollars ($10.00) which represents the permit fee.  The permit fee shall cover
the costs of reviewing the construction plans, inspecting the final
construction and processing the application.
(Ord. 85-24.  Passed 5-7-85.)
 
   1303.04  LOCATION OF THE EARTH STATION.
   (a)   Ground Mounted.
      (1)   No earth station shall be constructed in any front or side yard,
but shall be constructed in the rear yard of the property.
      (2)   No earth station, including its concrete base slab or other
structure, shall be constructed less than three feet from any property line or
easement.
      (3)   No earth station shall exceed a height of fifteen feet above grade.
      (4)   Wiring between an earth station and a receiver shall be placed at
least four inches beneath the surface of the ground within a protective
covering.
      (5)   Any driving motor shall be limited in power design to conform with
earth station industry-approved actuators.
      (6)   An earth station shall be bonded to a grounding rod.
 
   (b)   Roof Mounted.
      (1)   Earth stations shall be mounted directly upon the roof of a primary
or accessory structure, as defined by the Building Code, and shall not be
mounted upon appurtenances such as chimneys, towers, trees, poles or spires.
      (2)   The distance between the roof and the lower edge of a roof-mounted
earth station shall not exceed three feet.
      (3)   Any driving motor shall be limited in power design so as to conform
with earth station-industry-approved actuators and shall be U.L. listed.
      (4)   A roof-mounted earth station must be bonded to a grounding rod.
         (Ord. 85-24.  Passed 5-7-85.)
 
   1303.05  APPEALS.
   (a)   Appeals from decisions of the Building and Zoning Inspector shall be
made by the applicant to the Board of Zoning Appeals as provided by the
Codified Ordinances.
 
   (b)   If the Board of Zoning Appeals determines an earth station cannot be
located in a rear yard, approval may be given for a side yard installation.  If
neither the rear nor the side yard can be used, the Board of Zoning Appeals may
grant a front yard installation.
 
   (c)   Earth Stations that are permitted by appeal in side or front yards
must be a perforated-designed dish.
(Ord. 85-24.  Passed 5-7-85.)
 
   1303.99  PENALTY.
   Whosoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
more than one hundred dollars ($100.00).  A separate violation shall be deemed
to have been committed each day during or on which a violation occurs or
continues to occur.
(Ord. 85-24.  Passed 5-7-85.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 1305
House Numbering
 
1305.01   Methods of numbering.
1305.02   Conspicuous numbers required.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
      Power to regulate building numbering - see Ohio R.C. 715.26
      Street grading and naming - see S.U. & P.S. Ch.
903
 
   1305.01  METHODS OF NUMBERING.
   (a)   In numbering buildings fronting toward any street of the City, even
numbers shall be placed upon the right-hand and odd numbers upon the left-hand
side of the street.  The starting points upon all streets having east or west
prefixed to their names or running east and west shall be either Benedict or
Whittlesey Avenues or the terminus of the east and west streets nearest toward
either of such streets, and for the streets running north and south either Main
Street or the terminus of the streets nearest Main Street shall be the starting
point.
 
   (b)   Proceeding from the initial point upon any street, the buildings
thereon shall be numbered in consecutive order, reserving, however, for each
sixty-six feet or fraction thereof of unoccupied or vacant lots and lands
abutting upon the street, a number which would belong to a building if there
was a building upon such unoccupied or vacant lot and land.  The Director of
Public Service and Safety shall, upon demand of the owner thereof, within a
reasonable time, furnish the appropriate number of any building within the City
fronting upon any public street or thoroughfare of the City.
(1961 Code Sec. 367)
 
   1305.02  CONSPICUOUS NUMBERS REQUIRED.
   All owners of buildings fronting upon any street or public thoroughfare are
required to place proper numbers in some conspicuous place upon such buildings,
in compliance with the provisions of Section
1305.01.  In default thereof, the same shall be placed thereon under the
supervision of the Director of Public Service and Safety and at the expense of
such owner, and the cost and expense thereof shall be assessed against such
property.
(1961 Code Sec. 368)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 1306
Exterior Property Maintenance Code
1306.01   Title.
1306.02   Scope.
1306.03   Purpose.
1306.04    Applicability.
1306.05    Conflict of laws.
1306.06    Enforcement.
1306.07   Maintenance responsibility.
1306.08   General exterior maintenance requirements.   
1306.09   Exterior surfaces.
1306.10   Foundations.
1306.11   Roofs, gutters, downspouts  and chimneys.
1306.12   Yard area maintenance.
1306.13    Unoccupied or inoperative structures and unoccupied lots.
1306.14    Definitions.
1306.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
         Public nuisances - see GEN.  OFF. 
521.06
         Littering - see GEN.  OFF. 
521.07
         Weeds  - see GEN.  OFF.
 521.15
         Junk vehicles - see GEN.  OFF.
 521.16
   1306.01  TITLE.
   This chapter shall be known as the Exterior Property Maintenance Code of the
City of Norwalk.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.)
   1306.02  SCOPE.
   The chapter is strictly limited to the establishment of minimum standards
for the maintenance of exterior surfaces and exterior functioning units of all
commercial and residential structures, buildings and uses within the City,
including yard areas immediately contiguous thereto. No provisions of this
chapter shall, in any way, directly or indirectly, be interpreted to interfere
with, or to limit the right of, any owner or resident to inhabit real property
owned or leased by them in such manner and form as they may determine
appropriate, consistent with other applicable provisions of law. This chapter
is directed to obvious visual problems which may occasion incipient blighting
conditions within the City. All matters of the interior use, occupancy or
habitation of any structure or building within the City are specifically
excluded from the provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.)
   1306.03  PURPOSE.
   The purpose of this chapter is to protect the public health, safety and
welfare by establishing minimum standards governing the maintenance, appearance
and exterior condition of all premises and uses throughout the City; to fix
certain responsibilities and duties upon owners and residents of the same as to
both separate and correlative responsibilities and duties; to authorize and
establish procedures for the exterior inspection of such premises and uses; to
fix penalties for the violations of this chapter; and to provide for the
repair, demolition or vacation of premises unfit for human habitation,
occupancy or use. This chapter is hereby declared to be remedial and essential
for the public interest, and it is intended that this chapter be construed and
interpreted to effectuate the purposes as stated herein.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.)
   1306.04  APPLICABILITY.
   Every building, occupancy or use shall comply with the provisions of this
chapter, whether or not such building or use shall have been constructed,
altered or repaired before or after the enactment of this chapter, and without
regard to any permits or licenses which shall have been issued for the use or
occupancy of the building premises, for the construction or repair of the
building or use, or for the installation or repair of equipment or facilities
prior to the effective date of this chapter. This chapter establishes minimum
standards for the initial and continued occupancy and use of all such
structures and does not replace or modify standards otherwise established for
the construction, repair, alteration or use of the building.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.)
   1306.05  CONFLICT OF LAWS.
   In any case where a provision of this chapter imposes a higher standard than
that set forth in any other ordinance by the City or law of the State, then the
standard set forth herein shall prevail, but if a provision of this chapter
imposes a lower standard than that imposed by any other ordinance of the City
or law of the State, then the higher standard contained in any such other
ordinance or law shall prevail.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.)
   1306.06  ENFORCEMENT.
   (a)    Inspection.  All buildings, premises, and uses within the City are
subject to exterior inspections from time to time by the Zoning Inspector or
Director of Safety/Service.
   (b)    Notice.
      (1)    Where a violation of any provision of this chapter other than a
violation of Section
1306.12(b) is found to exist, the Zoning Inspector shall cause a written notice
of such violation to be served upon the person responsible for the correction
thereof. The notice shall specify the violation committed. Within fourteen (14)
days of the date of service of notice, a reasonable period of time to correct
or abate the violation shall be established. Such reasonable period of time for
the correction and abatement of the violations shall be pursuant to a repair
schedule submitted in writing by the violator and approved by the zoning
inspector. In the event that weather is a major consideration in correcting or
abating the violation, the Zoning Inspector may extend the time set out herein
to not more than sixty (60) days immediately following the occurrence of
appropriate weather conditions.
      (2)    Notice shall be served by certified mail to the owner of the
property appearing on the current record of the county auditor and to the last
known address of any known tenant.
      (3)   In the event of a failure of certified mail service, service of any
notice shall be made by regular U.S. mail with certificate of mailing
accompanied by posting a copy of the notice of the front of the premises. 
Service shall be deemed complete upon such mailing and posting.
      (4)    In the absence of an appeal, as provided below, the completion of 
notice, and failure to comply, shall constitute a Final Order as to
administrative proceedings.
   (c)    Appeal.
       (1)   Within twenty-one (21) days of the date of service of notice, any
person affected by the notice may request a hearing thereof  before the Board
of Zoning Appeals by filing a written request with the  Zoning Inspector. The
Zoning Inspector shall forward such request to  the Board within three (3) days
of receipt. The Chairperson of the  Board, upon receipt of the request, shall
set the matter down for hearing  within thirty (30) days, allowing at least
five (5) days notice to the party  and the Zoning Inspector. The Board of
Zoning Appeals may sustain, modify or dismiss, in whole or in part any action
required to correct or  abate the violation set forth in the notice and shall
issue an order incorporating its determinations, and such order shall be a
Final Order as to these administrative proceedings.
      (2)    The Board of Zoning Appeals shall consider only the following in 
determining appropriate action to be taken, to wit:
         A.    That any modification of the original order of the Zoning
Inspector shall not, in any material way, alter the standards of this chapter
and shall not affect detrimentally the health or safety of occupants, or the
health, safety or welfare of the occupants or owners of adjacent premises or of
the immediate neighborhood; and
         B.    That strict enforcement would constitute an undue and
unnecessary hardship on the owner, manager or resident, by reason of compelling
an expenditure for repair of the premises which would be substantially
disproportionate to any benefit to the health, safety or welfare of the
community that might be derived therefrom.
      (3)    No license or permit or other certification of compliance with
this chapter shall constitute a defense against any violation of any other
local ordinance applicable to any structure or premises, nor shall any
provision herein relieve any owner, manager or resident from complying with any
such other provision, nor any official of the City from enforcing any such
other provision. 
         (Ord.  2015-048.  Passed 11-17-15.)
   1306.07  MAINTENANCE RESPONSIBILITY.
   (a)    The owner of every structure or use within the City shall be
responsible for maintaining the exterior surfaces of the same in conformance
with the provisions of this chapter.
   (b)    The owner and/or tenant of every structure or use within the City
shall be responsible for maintaining the yard area contiguous thereto in
conformance with the provisions of this chapter. Nothing contained herein shall
cause a tenant to be responsible for the maintenance of a yard that is a common
area.
   (c)    Unless expressly provided to the contrary in this chapter, the
respective obligations and responsibilities imposed herein upon the owner, as
differentiates from those of the tenants, shall not be altered or affected by
an agreement or contract by and between any of the aforesaid, or between them
and other parties.
   (d)   No owner shall knowingly permit a tenant to create any condition upon
the owner's property, which constitutes a violation of the provisions of this
chapter.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.)
   1306.08  GENERAL EXTERIOR MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)    The exterior surfaces of all structures or uses within the City
whether functional or aesthetic, shall be maintained in good repair. Any
exterior part or feature thereof having functional use shall be capable of
performing the use for which such part or feature was designed.
   
   (b)    The entire yard area and extending up to and including the lot line
in all directions, shall be maintained in a safe, clean and sanitary condition.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.)
   1306.09  EXTERIOR SURFACES.
   (a)    All exterior surfaces of every structure or use within the City shall
be maintained so as to resist decay or deterioration from any naturally
occurring cause. All exterior wood surfaces shall be covered with paint, finish
or other surface coating so as to prevent such decay or deterioration. An
exterior wall segment, facing or other distinguishable surface area having more
than twenty-five percent (25%) of its total area bare or otherwise
deteriorated, will require the wall segment, facing or other distinguishable
surface are to be surface-coated in its entirety. If the surface to be coated
is a portion of a larger structure, such surface coating shall be compatible in
color, texture and design with the entire structure.
   (b)    Any deteriorated or decayed exterior walls, doors, porches, floors,
steps, railings, or parts or features thereof, shall be repaired or replaced.
   (c)    Any damaged or broken windows, screens or shutters, and deteriorated
or decayed sill, sash, molding, lintel, frame or trim thereof shall be repaired
or replaced.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.)
   1306.10  FOUNDATIONS.
    (a)    The foundation of every structure or use within the City shall be
maintained in such condition and repair as to prevent damage to the structural
integrity of the same.
   (b)    All openings into the foundations of every dwelling structure shall
be protected against the entrance of rodents.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.)
   1306.11  ROOFS, GUTTERS, DOWNSPOUTS AND CHIMNEYS.
   The roof of every structure or use within the City shall be maintained
weathertight. All missing shingles, or other roofing materials, shall be
replaced with materials of similar kind, nature, design and color as the
original thereof. Any roof segment, or distinguishable portion thereof, having
more than twenty-five percent (25%) of its total area comprised of missing
shingles, or other roofing material, then the roof segment or distinguishable
portion thereof shall be replaced or repaired with materials of similar kind,
nature, design, and color as the original thereof. 
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.) 
   1306.12  YARD AREA MAINTENANCE.
   (a)    Refuse and Junk Vehicles.
      (1)    No furniture (except lawn furniture in good repair), mattresses,
household furnishings, rugs, appliances, unused posts, unregistered vehicles,
dilapidated or junk vehicles or vehicle parts, discarded or abandoned machinery
and construction equipment shall be placed or stored in any yard area or use
within the City over a period in excess of five (5) days.
      (2)    Exterior property areas of all premises or uses, including but not
limited to fences and driveways, shall be kept free of debris, objects,
materials or conditions that create a health, accident or fire hazard, or are a
public nuisance, or constitute a blighting or deteriorating influence on the
neighborhood. All debris shall be removed within five (5) days.
         (Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.)
   (b)    Grass, Weeds and Vegetation Control.
      (1)    No owner, tenant or person in physical control of any lot within
the City shall allow grasses, weeds or vegetation to attain a height of six
inches or more. Nor shall any person allow ragweed, daisies, goldenrod,
burdock, yellow dock, thistles or any other weed or vegetable capable of
exhaling offensive or noxious odors or from which there is carried by the wind
any injurious, offensive or annoying pollen, dust, seed or particles or which
may conceal filthy deposits, to grow on such lot or parcel of land and fail to
have the same closely mowed, cut or removed.
      (2)   The Director of Safety/Service shall cause an annual notice to be
published in a newspaper of general circulation in the City of Norwalk and to
be placed upon the City’s web site notifying the residents of the requirements
of this section.
      (3)   The Director of Safety/Service shall cause lots and lands within
the City suspected of being in violation of this section to be inspected.  If
lots and lands are found to be in violation, the Director of Safety/Service
shall cause to be served a one-time notice requiring the grasses, weeds or
vegetation to be cut within five (5) days and thereafter during the growing
season with sufficient frequency to prevent such grasses, weeds or vegetation
from exceeding six inches.  The notice shall be served on the property owner,
tenant or person in physical control of the property by certified U.S. mail, by
regular mail with a certificate of mailing upon failure of certified mail, or
may be hand delivered to such person or may be served residentially by leaving
a copy at the affected property.
      (4)   Only one notice pursuant to subsection (b)(3) hereof per year shall
be required for any lot or land found to be in violation of this section.  In
the event any lot or land is found to be in violation subsequent to the service
of said notice, the City may proceed in accordance with subsections (b)(5)
through (b)(7).
      (5)    If after the expiration of five (5) days from the date of service
of the notice, the lot or parcel of land has not been cut, the Director of
Safety/Service shall cause such weeds, grasses, or vegetation to be cut. The
Director of Safety/Service may employ the necessary labor to perform the task
or may contract to have such work performed.
      (6)    The owner, tenant, or person in physical control of the property
shall be charged the cost of such labor which shall be provided by the City or
by an independent contractor.  Such cost shall be determined by an hourly rate
to be established yearly by the Director of Safety/Service, who shall set such
rate based on the anticipated costs of contracting to have the work performed
plus the associated costs of administering the work including but not limited
to performing inspections, delivering the notices, contracting for services,
and collection and enforcement actions.
         (Ord. 2009-052.  Passed 11-17-09.)
      (7)   A statement of the costs shall be mailed to the owner or
responsible party of such land by certified mail, return receipt requested.  In
the event such certified mail is returned endorsed “unclaimed” or “refused”,
the statement shall be sent by regular U.S. mail with certificate of mailing. 
In the event the whereabouts of the owner or responsible party are unknown, the
statement shall be posted upon the premises.  Receipt of the statement shall be
deemed completed upon the signing of the certified mail receipt, the mailing of
the regular mail with certificate of mailing, or the posting of the statement
upon the premises.  Such cost shall be paid within seven days after the receipt
of the statement, or such amount shall be certified to the County Auditor to be
placed on the tax duplicate becoming a lien on such property to be collected as
other taxes and returned to the City’ General Fund. 
         (Ord. 2013-051.  Passed 11-5-13.)
      (8)   This section shall not apply to cultivated flowers, gardens,
undeveloped wooded areas or farmland except that no such areas may obstruct the
vision of motorists and pedestrian traffic on or near public roads.
         (Ord. 2009-052.  Passed 11-17-09.)
   (c)    Accessory Structures.
      (1)    All structures or uses located in the yard area within the City,
such as sheds, barns, garages, bins and the like, shall be maintained in good
repair in conformance with other provisions of this chapter having regard to
foundations, roofs and exterior surfaces.
      (2)    Any broken, rusted, deteriorated or decayed fence, yard, enclosure
or other device or structure located in the yard area contiguous to any
structures or use within the City shall be repaired or removed.
   (d)    Ground Surface Hazards.   Holes, cracks, excavations, breaks,
projections and obstructions at any place on the premises, including but not
limited to driveways and sidewalks, which in the opinion of the Zoning
Inspector, are a hazard to persons using the premises shall not be permitted.
   (e)    Storm Water Drainage.  Storm water shall be properly drained to
prevent recurrent or excessive ponding or the entrance of water into any crawl
space, basement or cellar. Downspouts, foundation drains, and other storm and
surface water drains shall not be connected to sanitary sewers. Storm water
drainage shall not be directed at adjoining properties when such adjoining
property is within ten (10) feet of the point of discharge.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.) 
   1306.13  UNOCCUPIED OR INOPERATIVE STRUCTURES AND UNOCCUPIED LOTS.
   (a)   Unoccupied or inoperative structures, and the lot upon which any
structure is located, as well as unoccupied lots, shall be maintained in
accordance with the provisions of this chapter.  Any such lot shall be provided
with grass or other appropriate ground cover or landscaping material so as to
assure absorption of rainfall and prevent erosion and rapid runoff of surface
water.  The owner shall cut and maintain all grass or other ground cover and
remove all rubbish and weeds from the premises.  The parking of motor vehicle
upon said premises shall be prohibited.
   (b)   If any structure or use shall become unoccupied or inoperative and not
maintained according to provisions of this chapter for a period more than one
hundred eighty (180) days, it shall be presumed to be a nuisance affecting or
endangering surrounding property values and to be detrimental to the public
health, safety, convenience, comfort, property or general welfare of the
community and shall be abated.
   (c)   Whenever the Zoning Inspector shall find any structure to be
unoccupied and an inoperative nuisance, notice shall be given in the same
manner as service of summons in civil cases or by certified mail addressed to
the owner of record of the premises at his last known address or to the address
to which tax bills are sent, or by a combination of the foregoing methods, to
abate such unoccupied or inoperative nuisance condition within thirty days
either by placing the structure in operation in accordance with this section,
adapting and using the structure for another use permitted in the Zoning
District or by razing the structure, removing all debris, any signs, goods,
supplies and equipment, and filling depressions to the grade level of the lot,
provided, however, that if the structure is in use at the time notice is given
and remaining in operation for ninety consecutive days, the provisions of this
section shall not apply.
   (d)   Upon the failure, neglect or refusal of any owner to comply with the
notice to abate such unoccupied and inoperative nuisance, the Zoning Inspector
shall advise the Law Director of all the facts and the Law Director shall
proceed to exercise on behalf of the City any remedy which shall then be
available to it to secure an abatement of such unoccupied or inoperative
nuisance, including, but not limited to, any remedy that pertains to the
abatement of a public nuisance, and to recover any damages or enforce any
penalties which may be recovered or imposed at the instance of the City,
including all damages reasonable under Ohio R.C. 715.26 and 715.261.
   (e)   The remedies contained in this section shall be cumulative and shall
apply in addition to any other remedial sections in this Code, including but
not specifically limited to, Section
1307.06 of the Building Code.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.) 
   1306.14  DEFINITIONS.
   (a)    “Common Area” for the purposes of this chapter shall be defined as an
area in or upon or part of a rental property which may be used by more than one
tenant.
   (b)    “Owner” for the purposes of this chapter shall be defined as the
person listed on the county auditor's tax records as the owner of a parcel.
   (c)    “Rental Agreement” for the purposes of this chapter shall mean any
agreement or lease, written or oral which entitles a tenant to use and occupy a
premises.
   (d)    “Rental Property” for the purposes of this chapter shall mean any
property which is occupied by one or more tenant.
   (e)    “Tenant” for the purposes of this chapter shall mean a person
entitled under a rental agreement to the exclusive use and occupancy of a
premises.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.) 
   1306.99  PENALTY.
   (a)    Whenever the person responsible under this chapter with the
maintenance of a structure or premises fails to comply with any Final Order as
provided in this chapter, the Law Director may file an action seeking
injunctive relief or other remedies provided by law.
   (b)    Whoever violates any provision of this chapter, or fails to comply
with any Final Order as provided herein shall, upon conviction, be guilty of a
minor misdemeanor. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day on
which a violation occurs or continues.
   (c)    Whoever violates any provision of this chapter, or fails to comply
with any Final Order as provided herein, on more than one subject matter in any
two (2) year period separate and distinct from a conviction upon a prior
subject matter, shall be, upon conviction of the same, guilty of a misdemeanor
of the third degree. A separate offense on such subsequent subject matter
within two (2) years shall be deemed committed each day on which a violation or
noncompliance occurs or continues.
   (d)    Whoever violates Section
1306.12(b) shall, upon conviction, be guilty of a minor misdemeanor. On each
subsequent offense, a violator shall, upon conviction, be guilty of a
misdemeanor of the fourth degree.
(Ord. 2002-051.  Passed 7-30-02.) 
 
 
CHAPTER 1307
Dangerous or Fire Damaged Structures
 
1307.01   Definitions.
1307.02   Inspection and notification.
1307.03   Method of notification.
1307.04   Right of appeal.
1307.05   Posting of notice.
1307.06   Vacation and demolition by City.
1307.07   Rehabilitation or restoration.
1307.08   Fire-damaged structures; removal, repair or  securing fund.
1307.09   Abatement.
1307.10   Enforcement Officer.
1307.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
      Removal of unsafe structures - see Ohio R.C. 715.26 et seq.
      Fire damaged structures: removal fund - see Ohio R.C. 3929.86
 
   1307.01  DEFINITIONS.
   (a)    Dangerous or unfit building. Dangerous or unfit building means a
structure possessing any of the following defects:
      (1)    Structures whose interior or exterior bearing walls or other
vertical structural members list, lean, or buckle to such an extent as to
weaken the structural support they provide;
      (2)    Structures which show damage to or deterioration of approximately
one-third or more of the supporting member or members, or damage or
deterioration of approximately fifty percent  (50%) or more of the
nonsupporting enclosing or outside walls or covering;
      (3)    Structures which have improperly distributed loads upon the floors
or roofs or in which the same are overloaded to a dangerous degree, or which
have insufficient strength to be reasonably safe for the purpose used;
      (4)    Structures which have been so damaged by wind, or other causes as
to no longer provide adequate shelter from the elements, or have become
dangerous to life, health, safety, morals, or the general welfare of the
occupants or the public;
      (5)    Structures lacking facilities required by this or other City
ordinances or  codes, for egress in case of fire or panic, or those having
insufficient stairways, elevators, fire escapes, or other means of access;
      (6)    Structures and premises lacking the minimum light, air, and
sanitation facilities required by this or other City ordinances or codes for
the protection of present and future occupants;
      (7)    Structures which have parts or appurtenances which are so attached
that they may fall and injure occupants or the general public, or damage
property;
      (8)    Structures and premises which have become or are dilapidated,
decayed,  unsafe, insanitary, or vermin-infested, or which are likely to cause
sickness, disease, or injury to occupants or the general public; or
      (9)    Structures and premises which constitute a serious hazard to the
health or  safety of the occupants or the general public because of the
location, general conditions, state of the premises, or overcrowding.
 
   (b)    Fire Damaged or Deteriorated Structure.  Fire damaged or deteriorated
structure means any structure which has become damaged by fire or
deterioration; the extent of the damage in the judgment of the Fire Chief or
Building Official exceeds fifty percent (50%) of the value of the structure;
and the structure is judged unsafe and dangerous.
(Ord. 94-100. Passed  9-6-94; Ord. 2002-19.  Passed 3-5-02.)
 
   1307.02  INSPECTION AND NOTIFICATION.
   (a)    When any building or structure within the City is reported to the
Building Official or Fire Chief to be a dangerous or unfit structure or a fire
damaged or deteriorated structure, the Building Official or Fire Chief shall
inspect the building.
 
   (b)    If, upon inspection, a building or structure within the City is found
to be a dangerous or unfit structure, or a fire damaged or deteriorated
structure, the Building Official or Fire Chief shall immediately notify the
owner of the property of the condition of the property and shall order the
owner to vacate the structure, or cause the necessary repairs to commence, or
cause the structure to be vacated and institute the necessary repairs to the
structure.
 
   (c)    The order mentioned in this section shall be in writing and shall
specify the building, structure or portion thereof found to be dangerous,
unfit, fire damaged, or deteriorated, and shall specify the repairs to be made
thereto, and direct the owner to cause the repairs to be made, or the building
or structure will be demolished. The order shall direct that the repairs
commence within a period of two weeks from service of notice, and to proceed
with the repairs so commenced without interruption and with diligence until
completed.
(Ord. 94-100. Passed  9-6-94.)
 
   1307.03  METHOD OF NOTIFICATION.
   The notice and order provided for in Section
1307.02 shall be served upon the owner, and upon any mortgagee and other person
having an interest in the building as shown by the county land records, as
follows:
   (a)   By personal service upon the owner, mortgagee or other person having
an interest in the building; or
   (b)   By certified U.S. mail, return receipt requested, to the last known
address of the owner, mortgagee or other person having an interest in the
building, or to the address listed in the County Auditor’s Office for real
estate tax mailing purposes.
   (c)   Service shall be deemed complete upon receipt of the personal service
or the certified mail service.
   (d)   In the event the certified mail service shall be returned endorsed
“unclaimed” or “refused”, service may be made by regular U.S. mail with
certificate of mailing to the same address.  Service shall be deemed complete
upon the mailing of such service.
   (e)   In the event of a failure of personal service and mail service,
service may be made by posting a copy of the notice and order in a conspicuous
place in or upon the building affected and by causing the notice and order to
be published once in a newspaper of general circulation in the City.  Service
shall be deemed complete thirty (30) days following said publication.
      (Ord. 2013-028.  Passed 5-21-13.)
 
   1307.04  RIGHT OF APPEAL.
   (a)    The Board of Building and Zoning Appeals shall also be the Board of
Building Appeals for purposes of this chapter.
 
   (b)    Any owner, mortgagee, or other interested person of any building,
structure, or portion thereof, ordered to vacate or to make repairs, or to
demolish the building, structure, or portion, may,  within ten days from the
date of service of the written notice to repair or demolish as provided above,
file with the Board of Appeals his or her written objection to the order. The
objection shall be filed with the Clerk of the Board of Appeals together with a
fee of fifty dollars ($50.00). In the event of an objection being filed, a
hearing shall be held at the first available hearing date, upon the question of
whether or not the building, structure, or portion thereof is a dangerous,
unfit, fire damaged, or deteriorated building or structure. The owner,
mortgagee, or other interested party of the building or structure shall be
notified in writing of the date, time, and place of the hearing. The notice of
hearing shall be so given at least forty-eight  hours in advance of the time of
the hearing by the Clerk of the Board of Appeals.
(Ord. 2011-023.  Passed 6-7-11.)
 
   (c)    At any hearing before the Board of Appeals, the Building Official or
Fire Chief shall report in person the findings made upon his inspection of the
building or structure, and shall present with the Law Director other evidence
as may be available in support thereof. The owner, mortgagee, or other
interested person shall then be heard, and the Board of Appeals shall receive
evidence as may be offered tending to rebut the findings and evidence presented
by the Building Official. Thereupon, the Board of Appeals shall determine
whether or not the building, structure, or portion thereof is a dangerous,
unfit, fire damaged or deteriorated building, and shall notify all interested
parties of its decision within seven  days of the hearing. If the Board of
Appeals finds that the building or structure, or portion to be dangerous,
unfit, fire damaged or deteriorated so, it shall so notify the Law Director by
the same written finding it issued to the interested parties.
 
   (d)    Upon receipt of a decision adverse to any interested party such
interested party may commence repairs or demolition of the structure within
fourteen  days of receipt of such decision or may appeal the decision of the
Board of Appeals as provided in Ohio R.C. Chapter 2506.
(Ord. 94-100.  Passed 9-6-94.)
   (e)    If any interested party does not commence proceedings to repair or
demolish any structure found by the Board of Appeals to be unfit, dangerous,
fire damaged, or deteriorated within thirty (30)  days from the date of receipt
of the decision of the Board of Appeals, or appeal such decision to the
appropriate court, the Director of Law shall cause an abatement action to be
brought in the appropriate venue pertaining to the structure. (Ord. 2013-028. 
Passed 5-21-13.)
 
   (f)    The Clerk of the Board of Appeals shall forward a copy of the Board’s
findings to all interested parties by certified mail, return receipt requested
within seven  days of the Board's hearing.  (Ord. 94-100. Passed  9-6-94.)
 
   1307.05  POSTING OF NOTICE.
   Any building, structure, or portion thereof declared to be a dangerous,
unfit, or a fire damaged or deteriorated structure, shall be posted with a
placard by the Building Official or Fire Chief. The placard shall be affixed to
the building or structure, upon the door or entrance thereto, and shall contain
a declaration that the structure is dangerous, unfit, fire damaged, or
deteriorated, and is ordered vacated. No person shall deface or remove such
placard. The Building Official or Fire Chief shall remove the placard whenever
the defect or defects upon which the vacation was based have been eliminated. 
(Ord. 94-100. Passed  9-6-94.)
 
   1307.06  VACATION AND DEMOLITION BY CITY.
   (a)    If the owner, mortgagee, or other interested person of the building
or structure affected fails to comply with the order of the Building Official
or Fire Chief within thirty (30) days of its service and does not appeal such
order to the Appeals Board as provided in Section
1307.04, the Building Official or Fire Chief shall cause the building,
structure, or part thereof to be vacated, and may cause the same to be repaired
or demolished.  The costs of repair or demolition shall be charged as a
municipal lien against the land on which the building exists or existed, or
shall be recovered in a suit at law against the owner, or shall be assessed
upon the tax duplicate of the real property.  (Ord. 2013-028.  Passed 5-21-13.)
 
   (b)    In cases where the building official or Fire Chief deems that there
is immediate danger to the life or safety of any person unless a dangerous,
unfit, fire damaged, or deteriorated building as defined herein, is immediately
vacated and repaired or demolished, the Building Official or Fire Chief shall
cause the immediate vacation and repair or demolition of the dangerous or unfit
building. The costs of emergency repair or demolition shall be charged or
recovered in the same manner as provided in subsection (a) hereof.  (Ord. 94-
100. Passed  9-6-94.)
 
   1307.07  REHABILITATION OR RESTORATION.
   Whenever the Building Official determines that a vacated, dangerous or unfit
building or premises has been so repaired, reconstructed, and rehabilitated
that it is in such condition as to be fit for human habitation or occupancy,
then he shall notify the owner or operator of that determination. The Building
Official shall then cause the placard to be removed.
(Ord. 94-100. Passed  9-6-94.)
 
   1307.08  FIRE-DAMAGED STRUCTURES; REMOVAL, REPAIR OR SECURING FUND.
   The Municipality hereby authorizes the adoption of the procedures set forth
in Ohio R.C. 3929.86(C) and (D), whereby no insurance company doing business in
the State shall pay a claim to a named insured for fire damage sustained by a
structure located within the City, unless there has been full compliance with
the applicable provisions of Ohio R.C. 3929.86, which is incorporated herein as
if fully rewritten. The Finance Director is hereby designated as the official
authorized to carry out the duties set forth in Ohio R.C. 3939.86. The Clerk of
Council shall file a certified copy of this section with the State
Superintendent of Insurance.
(Ord. 94-100. Passed  9-6-94.)
 
   1307.09  ABATEMENT.
   If the person served with a notice to order to repair or demolish a
dangerous or unfit structure, or a fire damaged or deteriorated building,
should commence repair or demolition of the structure but fail within ninety
days to complete the requirements of the notice or order, the Law Director
shall institute the appropriate proceeding to compel demolition of the
structure.
(Ord. 2013-028.  Passed 5-21-13.)
   1307.10  ENFORCEMENT OFFICER.
   For the purposes of this Chapter, the term “Building Official” includes the
Code Enforcement Officer and the Planning and Zoning Administration Officer.
(Ord. 2013-014.  Passed 3-19-13.)
 
   1307.99  PENALTY.
   (a)    Whosoever fails to comply with an order of the Building Official or
Fire Chief to vacate a building and has exhausted all remedies available to him
or her shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor. Each day of continued occupancy
after the order and after all remedies have been exhausted shall be a separate
violation.
 
   (b)    A violation of Section
1307.05 shall constitute a misdemeanor of the third degree.
(Ord. 94-100. Passed  9-6-94.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 1309
Compliance and General Provisions; Penalty
 
1309.01   Compliance required.
1309.02   Order to correct violation; correction by City.
1309.03   Repairs within fire limits.
1309.04   Fire limits established.
1309.05   Electrical installations.
1309.06   Open underground areas to be guarded.
1309.07   Width of residential driveways.
1309.08   Requirements for new buildings.
1309.09   Bus or truck bodies not to be used as residences.
1309.10   Inspecting officer.
1309.11   Inspections.
1309.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
      Power to regulate building erection - see Ohio R.C. 715.26, 715.29,
737.28, 737.37
 
   1309.01  COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   No wall, structure, building or part thereof shall hereafter be built or
constructed, nor shall the wiring of any building, structure or premises be
constructed or altered in the City except in conformity with the provisions of
the Building Code.
 
   1309.02  ORDER TO CORRECT VIOLATION; CORRECTION BY CITY.
   If any building, edifice or structure is erected or the contents of any
building are contrary to the provisions of the Building Code, the Building and
Zoning Inspector shall notify in writing the owner, agent or occupant of the
building to remove such contents or to make the building, edifice or structure
conform to the requirements of this Building Code.  Any failure or default in
compliance with the order shall be treated as a refusal to comply with the
conditions hereof, and the Building and Zoning Inspector shall cause the
contents to be removed or the building altered, and shall assess the cost
against such property.
 
   1309.03  REPAIRS WITHIN FIRE LIMITS.
   No person shall alter or repair any wooden, frame or brick-cased building
within the fire limits of the City which is not in accordance with the
provisions of this Building Code which have been damaged by fire, decay or
action of the elements to the extent of fifty percent (50%) of the original
value, exclusive of the foundations.  Such repair or alterations can only be
made according to the provisions of this Building Code.
(1961 Code Sec. 457)
 
   1309.04  FIRE LIMITS ESTABLISHED.
   The fire limits in the City are established within the following boundaries:
   Commencing at the intersection of Church Street and West Main Street; thence
south on Church Street and a continuation thereof to Oak Street; thence east on
Oak Street to Norwood Avenue; thence north on Norwood Avenue to Summit Street;
thence east on Summit Street to South Linwood Avenue; thence north on South
Linwood Avenue to the south line of the right of way of the Nickel Plate
Railroad; thence east on such line to a line drawn as a continuation of Mill
Street; thence northwardly on the line drawn as a continuation of Mill Street
and on Mill Street and another line drawn as a continuation northwardly of Mill
Street to the north line of the right of way of the New York Central Railroad;
thence west along such line to Marshall Street; thence north on Marshall Street
to Rule Street; thence west on Rule Street to Prospect Street; thence north on
Prospect Street to Franklin Street; thence west on Franklin Street and as a
continuation thereof to Whittlesey Avenue; thence south on Whittlesey Avenue to
the south line of the New York Central Railroad; thence westwardly along such
line to a point where the continuation of Case Avenue intersects this line;
thence south on the continuation of Case Avenue to the point of beginning.
(1961 Code Sec. 458)
 
   1309.05  ELECTRICAL INSTALLATIONS.
   No electrical wiring or installation of electrical apparatus or appliances
for furnishing light, heat or power shall be installed into or placed in any
building in the City, unless the same is in compliance with the rules and
regulations of the National Electrical Code, in its most current form and as
hereafter amended, provided that the minimum electric service entrance shall be
100 amperes. 
(Ord. 2013-010.  Passed 3-5-13.)
 
   1309.06  OPEN UNDERGROUND AREAS TO BE GUARDED.
   No person shall maintain any open area between any building and a public
sidewalk or any stairway descending from such sidewalk or other public place,
without erecting and maintaining on both sides thereof an iron railing or fence
not less than three feet in height.
(1961 Code Sec. 462)
 
   1309.07  WIDTH OF RESIDENTIAL DRIVEWAYS.
   (a)   No person shall construct in any residence district any driveway
except in compliance with the City’s Engineering Standards for Construction.
(Ord. 2015-034.  Passed 8-4-15.)
 
   (b)   Such driveways shall be constructed in such location and in such
manner and with such material as may first be approved by the Code Enforcement
Officer.
(Ord. 97-85.  Passed 6-17-97.)
 
   1309.08  REQUIREMENTS FOR NEW BUILDINGS.
   No new buildings shall be constructed unless the following conditions are
complied with:
   (a)   Provisions must be made for the adequate drainage of all storm and
roof water into a storm sewer or into a natural drainage if no storm water
sewers are available.  The owner of any real property upon which the owner
intends to improve by construction, erecting or placing a residence, accessory
building or garage shall:
      (1)   Prepare and present to the City Engineer or Building Official a
site plan for the City’s review and approval prior to constructing, erecting or
placing such structure upon their real estate, indicating the following:
         A.   Property lines and dimensions.
         B.   Location of proposed building(s) including building setback
distances.
         C.   Elevations at lot corners.
         D.   Elevations at proposed building corners.
         E.   Proposed design for collection/dispersion of storm water.
      (2)   Grade their real estate so that no additional storm water shall be
diverted to neighboring real estate.
   (b)   Provisions must be made for drainage of all sanitary sewage into
sanitary sewers.  Drainage of sanitary sewage into storm sewers will not be
permitted, except into such combination sanitary and storm water sewers which
may exist in some parts of the City.  No person shall permit storm water to be
drained into a combination sewer.
   (c)   Sidewalks shall be constructed in accordance with Section
905.05.
   (d)   No occupancy permit shall be issued unless all the conditions herein
required have been complied with.
   (e)   Property owners who create drainage problems by grading their lots
towards adjoining property owners should be held responsible to correct any
resulting problems whether there are storm sewers available or not.
   (f)   Any person or firm violating or not conforming to the provisions of
this section shall be subject to the penalty provided in Section
1309.99.
      (Ord. 96-67.  Passed 7-2-96.)
 
   1309.09  BUS OR TRUCK BODIES NOT TO BE USED AS RESIDENCES.
   No bus, bus body, truck body or any other structure that was not originally
intended for use as a residence, or as an accessory to a residence, shall be
placed or used for residence purposes or for living quarters within the City
limits.  No such bus, bus body, truck body or other similar structure shall be
placed or used for any purpose within any residential district of the City.
(1961 Code Sec. 488)
 
   1309.10  INSPECTING OFFICER.
   The Code Enforcement Officer shall be the inspecting officer of the City.
(Ord. 97-44.  Passed 4-1-97.)
 
   1309.11  INSPECTIONS.
   The Building and Zoning Inspector shall have the right at all times to make
inspections of buildings in the City at all reasonable hours.
(Ord. 97-43.  Passed 4-1-97.)
 
   1309.99  PENALTY.
   (a)   Except as provided in subsection (b) hereof, no person, being the
owner or having the control as an officer, or as a member of a board or
committee or otherwise, of any building or structure or part thereof, shall
knowingly violate or shall permit or assist in the violation of any of the
provisions of this chapter and any person who may be employed or assist in the
commission of any such violation, and any person who shall violate or fail to
comply with any order or regulation made by proper authority, or who shall
build in violation of any detailed specifications or plans submitted or
approved thereunder, or of any certificate or permit issued thereunder, shall
be guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree for a first offense and a
misdemeanor of the first degree for each subsequent offense.
 
   (b)   Whoever violates Section
1309.08(c) shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor.  Any such violation shall
constitute a separate offense on each successive day continued.
(Ord. 95-24.  Passed 2-14-95.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 1313
Contractor's and Workmen's License (Repealed)
 
   EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Chapter
1313 was repealed by Ordinance 2013-009.
 
 
 
 
CHAPTER 1317
Awnings and Marquees
 
1317.01   Permit required.
1317.02   Permit approval.
1317.03   Liability.
1317.04   Installation height and support.
1317.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
         Sign regulations - see P. & Z. Ch.
1179
 
   1317.01  PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No occupant or owner of any building, structure or property within the City
shall hang, erect, install or maintain any awning, marquee or other structure
projecting into the highway, street or alley, or over any sidewalk, until a
permit for its installation and the approval of the construction of the same
shall have been secured from the City.
(1961 Code Sec. 420)
 
   1317.02  PERMIT APPROVAL.
   Such permit shall be issued upon the approval of the Director of Public
Service and Safety and the Building and Zoning Inspector.
(Ord. 67-2.  Passed 1-3-67.)
 
   1317.03  LIABILITY.
   The owner of the property upon which any projection over the sidewalk or
street is hung, by permit issued hereunder, shall assume all liability for any
damage resulting to property or persons by reason of installation or any
defects in same.  Such owner shall reimburse the City for any and all expenses
growing out of claims for damages that might be brought against the City.
(1961 Code Sec. 426)
 
   1317.04  INSTALLATION HEIGHT AND SUPPORT.
   Awnings and marquees erected in the City shall be erected above the public
streets or sidewalks at least eight feet and shall not project over any such
sidewalk more than three-fourths of the width thereof.  They shall be supported
exclusively from the building to which they are attached by iron fixtures.  Any
installation contrary to the provisions herein, if not made to conform thereto
after notice served upon the person maintaining the same by the Director of
Public Service and Safety shall be removed upon the order of Council.
(1961 Code Sec. 427)
 
   1317.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor.
 
 
 
CHAPTER 1321
Residential Building Code
 
1321.01   Building Codes adopted.
1321.02   Application and compliance.
1321.03   Building Official.
1321.04   Duties of Building Official; right of entry.
1321.05   Records.
1321.06   Building permit required.
1321.07   Fees.
1321.08   Inspections.
1321.09   Revocation, expiration and abandonment.
1321.10   Certificate of occupancy.
1321.11   Stop work order.
1321.12   Exceptions and existing structures.
1321.13   Exemption from liability.
1321.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
   Authority to regulate building erection - see Ohio R.C. 715.26,
      737.28
   Adoption of technical codes - see Ohio R.C. 731.231
   1321.01  BUILDING CODES ADOPTED.
   (a)   Pursuant to Section
4.09 of the Charter, the Residential Code of Ohio, published by the Ohio Board
of Building Standards, as it currently appears or may hereafter be amended and/
or supplemented, is hereby adopted as Residential Building Code of the City. 
   (b)   Pursuant to Section
4.09 of the Charter, the Residential Code of Ohio, published by the Ohio Board
of Building Standards, as it currently appears or may hereafter be amended and/
or supplemented, is hereby adopted as Residential Electrical Code of the City.
   (c)   Pursuant to Section
4.09 of the Charter, the Residential Code of Ohio, published by the Ohio Board
of Building Standards, as it currently appears or may hereafter be amended and/
or supplemented, is hereby adopted as Residential Plumbing Code of the City.
(Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.02  APPLICATION AND COMPLIANCE.
   (a)   The building codes adopted under Section
1321.01 shall apply to one, two and three-family dwelling units within the City
as hereinafter set forth. 
   (b)   No building or structure subject to this Chapter shall be
constructed,  erected, built, altered, enlarged, changed or modified except in
compliance with the building codes adopted under Section
1321.01.
   (c)   No owner or other person shall construct, erect, enlarge, build or
change any building or structure which is subject to this Chapter except in 
compliance with the building codes adopted under Section
1321.01.
   (d)   No architect, builder, engineer, plumber, carpenter, mason,
contractor, subcontractor, foreman or employee shall violate or assist in
violating this Chapter or the building codes adopted under Section
 1321.01, or fail to comply with any order issued pursuant thereto.
   (e)   No owner shall proceed with the construction, erection, alteration,
repair or enlargement of any building or structure subject to this Chapter
until the plans, drawings and specifications therefore have been approved
pursuant to this Chapter.  No plans or specifications shall be approved or
permit or certificate issued unless the building or structure represented
would, if constructed, erected, altered, repaired or enlarged, comply with this
Chapter and the building codes adopted under Section
 1321.01.
(Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.03  BUILDING OFFICIAL.
   (a)   The Mayor shall enter into a contract with a duly qualified person or
agency, licensed and certified by the State of Ohio, to serve as the Building
Official to enforce the provisions of the building codes and this Chapter.
   (b)   In the event the City shall establish a Building Department, duly
licensed and certified by the State of Ohio, the powers and duties of the
Building Official shall be assigned to such Department and the Building
Official shall be appointed by the Mayor.
(Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.04  DUTIES OF BUILDING OFFICIAL; RIGHT OF ENTRY.
   (a)   The Building Official shall perform the following duties:
      (1)   Review, approve or disapprove building plans;
      (2)   Inspect construction as required by law;
      (3)   Issue building permits in accordance with this Chapter;
      (4)   Issue stop-work orders as required by this Chapter;
      (5)   Otherwise perform the duties required of the Building Official by
    this Chapter or by law.
   (b)   The Building Official may employ assistants to carry out the duties of
this  Chapter provided said assistants are duly qualified and licensed by the
State of Ohio to perform such duties.
   (c)   Right of Entry.
      (1)   The Building Official or any authorized assistant may at any
reasonable hour enter any property or structure within the City  subject to
this Chapter to perform the duties imposed by this Building Code.  In the event
permission to enter is refused or unobtainable, the Building Official shall
secure a search warrant before making entry, except in the case of an existing
emergency in which case entry may be made at any time without a warrant.
      (2)   No person shall refuse to permit such emergency entry or
inspection, nor shall any person hinder, obstruct, resist or abuse any person
making or attempting to make such emergency entry.
         (Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.05  RECORDS.
   The Building Official shall keep or cause to be kept in a proper filing
system, records of the locations and character of every building for which a
permit is issued under this Chapter.  Records shall be kept of all inspections
and reports made.
(Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.06  BUILDING PERMIT REQUIRED.
   (a)   Prior to commencing or proceeding with the erection, construction,
alteration, repair or modification of any building or structure or part thereof
subject to this Chapter, including additions thereto, a building permit shall
be obtained by the owner, or the owner's agent, engineer, or architect, from
the Building Official.  No person shall commence or proceed with any such work
unless such building permit has been obtained.
   (b)   An application for the building permit shall be made in writing to the
Building Official upon such forms or in such form, electronic or otherwise, as
specified by the Building Official. The application shall be accompanied by the
zoning permit, plans and specifications of the building or structure for which
the application is made, containing complete information including but not
limited to a satisfactory estimate of cost.  Incomplete and imperfect plans
shall not be accepted.
   (c)   Upon receipt of the application, plans and specifications, the zoning
permit, and the fee as specified in Section
1321.07, the Building Official shall review the same.  When the applications,
plans and specifications conform with the requirements of this Chapter, the
Building Official is authorized to place his official signature thereon, issue
the building permit, and return the same to the applicant.  A copy of the
building permit and the plans and specifications, properly signed, shall be
kept on the work site until the work has been completed.  A copy of the plans
and specifications shall be left with the Building Official who shall retain
the same until the work has been completed and a certificate of occupancy
issued.  Thereafter, such plans and specifications shall be destroyed unless
picked up by the owner within thirty (30) days.
(Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.07  FEES.
   The Building Official shall establish the schedule of fees applicable to the
issuance of permits and certificates required by this Chapter.  No permit as
required in Section
1321.06 and no certificate as required in Section
 1321.10 shall be issued until the appropriate fee has been paid.  No amendment
to any permit or certificate shall be issued or approved until such additional
fee, if any, due to an increase in the size or estimated cost of the building
or structure, shall have been paid.  (Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.08  INSPECTIONS.
   (a)   The Building Official shall make such inspections of the building or
structure for which the building permit was issued as will reasonably insure
compliance with the provisions of this Chapter.
   (b)   No person shall refuse to permit the Building Official to perform the
inspections required by this Section nor shall any person hinder, interfere
with or abuse the Building Official in the performance of the duties of this
Section.
(Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.09  REVOCATION, EXPIRATION AND ABANDONMENT.
   (a)   Upon the issuance of the building permit, work for which the building
permit was issued shall commence within sixty (60) days.  The failure to
commence work as required by this section shall be cause for revocation of the
building permit.  Revocation is deemed accomplished by serving written notice
thereof upon the owner of the property upon which the work is to take place,
his architect, general contractor or designated agent, or by fixing such notice
to the visible part of the premises involved.
   (b)   Building permits shall expire one (1) year after the date of issuance
unless extended as provided in this Section.  The failure to complete work
within said one (1) year period shall be deemed abandonment of the permit and
shall constitute grounds for revocation.  A building permit may be extended
beyond said one (1) year period upon application to the Building Official. 
Such extension may not exceed one (1) year and no more than one (1) extension
may be granted to any building permit.
   (c)   Upon revocation, expiration or abandonment of the building permit,
there shall be no refund of the fees paid.
(Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.10  CERTIFICATE OF OCCUPANCY.
   (a)   Upon completion of the work for which the building permit was issued,
the Building Official shall issue a certificate of occupancy if, upon
inspection, the Building Official has determined that the work, building or
structure conforms with the requirements of this Chapter.
   (b)   No certificate of occupancy shall be issued unless the work, building
or structure for which the building permit was issued conforms with the
requirements of this Chapter.
   (c)   No person shall occupy or use any building or structure for which a
building permit was issued or required under this Chapter unless a certificate
of occupancy has been issued therefore.  (Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.11  STOP WORK ORDER.
   (a)   Whenever the Building Official finds any work regulated by this
Chapter  being performed in a manner contrary to the provisions of this Chapter
or the codes adopted hereunder or in a dangerous or unsafe manner, the Building
Official is authorized to issue a stop work order.  The stop work order shall
specify the reason for the order, the violations involved and the work to be
stopped.
   (b)   The stop work order shall be in writing and shall be served upon the
owner of the property or to the owner's agent and to the person performing the
work.  In the event the aforesaid cannot be served with the stop work order,
the order may be visibly posted at the work site and such posting shall
constitute service.  Upon issuance and service of the stop work order, the
cited work shall immediately cease and shall not resume until authorized by the
Building Official.
   (c)   No person shall continue any work subject to a stop work order after
issuance and service of the order, except such work as that person is directed
to perform to remedy the violation or unsafe condition.  Failure to cease work
after issuance and service of a stop work order constitutes a violation of this
Chapter and a public nuisance.
(Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.12  EXCEPTIONS AND EXISTING STRUCTURES.
   (a)   No permit shall be required for minor interior repairs or for
alterations to any building which do not involve any change in their supporting
walls, members or structural parts, or their stairways, elevators, fire escapes
or other means of ingress or egress, or light or ventilation, or do not, by
their installation, become a violation of the building codes adopted in Section
1321.01.
   (b)   The provisions of this Chapter shall apply to and control the
alteration, repair, enlargement, addition and change in any existing one, two
or three-family dwelling unit building or structure existing on the effective
date of this Chapter.  The occupancy of any such existing structure shall be
permitted without change provided the alleged occupancy can be established to
have existed for more than two (2) years prior to the effective date of this
Chapter, that there were no pending orders from any building, zoning, fire or
health official as to the structure and that there is no serious safety or
sanitation hazard.
(Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.13  EXEMPTION FROM LIABILITY.
   Any person, firm, owner or organization to whom a building permit is issued
under this Chapter shall save, indemnify, and hold harmless, the City against
any and all liability, judgments, damages, costs and expenses which may in any
way accrue against the City in consequence of the issuance of any permit or
certificate under this Chapter.
(Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
   1321.99  PENALTY.
   (a)   No person shall violate any provision of this Chapter.
   (b)   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter or any order issued
hereunder shall be guilty of an unclassified misdemeanor and shall be fined up
to two hundred dollars ($200.00).  Each day during which a violation of this
Chapter continues shall be deemed a separate offense.
(Ord. 2011-014.  Passed 4-19-11.)
 
 
 
 
CHAPTER 1325
House Moving
 
1325.01   Permit required; fee.
1325.02   Insurance required.
1325.03   Permit approval; police escort and conditions.
1325.04   Permit limitations.
1325.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
      Power to license house movers - see Ohio R.C. 715.27
      Use of local streets - see TRAF.
339.02(b)
 
   1325.01  PERMIT REQUIRED; FEE.
   No person shall move any building or structure within the corporate limits
of the City unless he shall first have obtained a house moving permit from the
Director of Public Service and Safety.  The fee for the issuance of any permit
to move any building or structure across any sidewalk, street or other public
place within the City limits shall be fifteen dollars ($15.00).  The fee for a
permit to move any structure or building from one location to another without
traversing any public ground shall be five dollars ($5.00).
(Ord. 66-42.  Passed 10-11-66.)
 
   1325.02  INSURANCE REQUIRED.
   An applicant shall submit evidence of insurance as approved by the Director
of Law indemnifying the applicant and the City in the sum of not less than
fifty thousand dollars ($50.00) for property damage and one hundred thousand
dollars/three hundred thousand dollars ($100,000/$300,000) for death or
personal injury.  The insurance policy shall provide that the City be named as
an insured and further, that the applicant and his insurer shall hold the City
harmless against any and all liabilities, judgments, damages, costs and
expenses which may in any manner accrue or arise against the City in
consequence of the granting of any permit for the moving of any house or the
performance of any work pursuant thereto.
(Ord. 66-42.  Passed 10-11-66.)
 
   1325.03  PERMIT APPROVAL; POLICE ESCORT AND CONDITIONS.
   (a)   Before any permit for moving any structure or building is issued, it
shall be approved by the Director of Public Service and Safety and the Building
and Zoning Inspector.  The Director shall not issue a house moving permit
unless it is first determined that the proposed location of the building or
structure, if within the City, conforms to the Zoning Ordinance, the Building
Code relative to the fire limits and other applicable provisions of any other
City ordinance.
 
   (b)   Whenever it is deemed necessary in the public interest, the Director
may require that any moving operations be conducted under the supervision of
such number of policemen as may be reasonably required to safeguard life and
property during the course of the moving operation.  The Director may prescribe
such reasonable conditions, requirements, routes and precautions, the days and
hours during which such moving operation shall be conducted and such other
measures as may be necessary in the public interest.  All moving operations
shall be in conformity therewith.
(Ord. 67-2.  Passed 1-3-67.)
 
   1325.04  PERMIT LIMITATIONS.
   The following limitations shall apply to the issuance of any permit for the
moving of a building or structure:
   (a)   The granting of a permit shall not guarantee that the load described
can be moved without damage to the pavement or structure.
   (b)   The Director of Public Service and Safety may, if the circumstances
warrant, require a cash bond to be posted to indemnify the City for any damage
to streets or other property, or to cover the cost of the removal of any
overhanging wires or traffic lights, or the furnishing of any police escort
which may be necessary in connection with the movement.
   (c)   The permit may restrict the movement of the vehicle or structure to
the streets specified, between the points designated, and within the time
allotted.
   (d)   No vehicle or structure shall be left parked on the roadway either
during the day or at night, except in case of an emergency.  In such event,
adequate lights and warning devices shall be provided for the traveling public.
   (e)   The permittee shall comply with all laws, rules and regulations
covering the movement of traffic over streets and with reductions of legal
weights posted on roadways or bridges.  The movement shall be conducted at such
speeds and in such manner as to cause a minimum of interference with other
traffic and minimum impact stresses on the roadway pavement.
   (f)   A permit will not be issued for built-up loads that may be divisible
into lighter or legal loads.
   (g)   Loads having extremely large dimensions shall require additional
protective measures when necessary for the protection of the public.  Red
flags, flagmen, a pilot car or other warning devices may be required.
   (h)   The permit is issued with the understanding that it shall become null
and void at any time when road, weather or traffic conditions make the moving
operation unsafe.
      (Ord. 66-42.  Passed 10-11-66.)
 
   1325.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor.  Any such violation shall constitute a separate offense on each
successive day continued.
 
 
 
CHAPTER 1333
Downtown Architectural Design Standards
 
1333.01   Adopted.
1333.02   Architectural and Historical Board of Review.
1333.03   Downtown Historical District.
 
CROSS REFERENCES

1141

which will be applicable only to those projects utilizing federal funding in
part or in whole, as contained in Exhibit A attached to Ordinance 88-38 and
incorporated herein by reference as if fully rewritten herein.
(Ord. 88-38.  Passed 6-7-88.)

pursuant to the requirements, powers of appointment, authorities and
responsibilities designated to such Board in Exhibit A of Ordinance 88-38,

as designated in Exhibit B to Ordinance 88-38, and incorporated herein by
reference as if fully rewritten herein, which will be applicable only to those
projects utilizing federal funding in part or in whole.
(Ord. 88-38.  Passed 6-7-88.)
